title: General Knowledge Quiz
description: Test your knowledge on a variety of general topics.

questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris is the capital and most populous city of France.

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.explanation: Mars is often called the Red Planet due to its reddish appearance.

questions.question: Who wrote 'Romeo and Juliet'?
questions.explanation: Romeo and Juliet is a tragedy written by William Shakespeare early in his career.

questions.question: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest ocean on Earth.

questions.question: Which element has the chemical symbol 'O'?
questions.explanation: Oxygen is represented by the chemical symbol 'O' on the periodic table.

questions.question: In which year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with the surrender of Nazi Germany in May and Japan in September.

questions.question: What is the tallest mountain in the world?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest, located in the Himalayas, is the Earth's highest mountain above sea level.

questions.question: Which country is known as the Land of the Rising Sun?
questions.explanation: Japan is often referred to as the Land of the Rising Sun because the sun appears to rise from the direction of Japan when viewed from China.

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.explanation: The Mona Lisa is a half-length portrait painting by Italian artist Leonardo da Vinci.

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
questions.explanation: Gold's chemical symbol 'Au' comes from the Latin word 'aurum', meaning gold.
